intro: Staphisagria macrosperma, commonly known as the large-seeded celandine, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive crown-like structure, and its leaves are typically alternate and deeply lobed. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, dark seeds. Staphisagria macrosperma is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
